subject: Update deprecated libprivilege-control API functions.

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

The deprecated API is going to be removed from libprivilege-control. Please verify this patch set.

Also please tell me if I should push this change to some IVI specific branch.

Patch Set 1:

If noone cares about wrt and libprivilege-control maybe just abandon this?

subject: In the previous code,  when modifying argv[0] string value from "/usr/bin/wrt_launchpad_dameon" to "/usr/bin/wrt_launchpad_daemon_candidate"  with a few space character padded in the end ,  in wrt-client.c, it calls sprintf() function without checking the
commitMessage:
In the previous code, 
when modifying argv[0] string value from "/usr/bin/wrt_launchpad_dameon" to "/usr/bin/wrt_launchpad_daemon_candidate" 
with a few space character padded in the end , 
in wrt-client.c, it calls sprintf() function without checking the argv[0] buffer size.

This patch uses snprintf instead of sprintf when modifying argv[0] to avoid overflow the string buffer

Change-Id: I76a331506a4d1587815e29072ee5a00752243034
Signed-off-by: Chi Ding <chi.ding@mobica.com>

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 3: Verified-1 Code-Review-1

wrt_launchad should be launched with empty and long arg (take a look on systemd service ).

It never fail.

the process should have the name wrt_launchpad_daemon_candidate.
If not, it will break the system at the runtime.



You should catch the return value of snprintf.
and print a message and exit the process, if the wrt-client is launched with a string that not enough to contains "wrt_launchpad_daemon_candidate"


Wich test case are you using to get this kind of error?

Patch Set 3:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 3:

I didn't enocounter issue but  noticed the code using sprintf() function to modify argv[0] without checking buffer size while I was debugging another issue.

Yes, I checked the command line to start /usr/bin/wrt-launchpad_daemon and the length is 233 Bytes. It's more than enough. Therefore I think this patch can be ignored.

Thanks.
